ovdesc.p: This file is used to set up the default charges for all Letter of Credit/ Documentary Collections and Drawing types. Each input into the Letter of Credit system will have a set of default charges in this file set up.
The defaulting mechanism works by defining in this file a record corresponding to each type of L/C (LC.TYPE), together with the operations that can be performed.
The key used to extract records from this file for Letter of Credit input will be the LC.TYPE input and the OPERATION input.
The key used to pick default charges for Drawings input under a Letter of Credit will be the LC.TYPE and the Drawing type.
For example, if there is an LC TYPE record with key as 'BILL', then the user should define here the following four records for default charges to the Letter of Credit file:
BILL-O For operation 'O' BILL-P For operation 'P' BILL-A For operation 'A' BILL-T For operation 'T'

However, whilst it is beneficial to have a default facility, Letter of Credit especially are not stereotype with regards to their terms and conditions. Subsequently commissions/charges (as recorded in the FT.COMMISSION.TYPE and FT.CHARGE.TYPE files) can be input if need be, separately to override the default and match the requirements.
And for drawings under the LC.TYPE, the following records could be set up:

BILL-AC For Acceptance BILL-DP For Deferred Payment BILL-DC For Documentary Collections BILL-SP For Sight Payments BILL-CO For Collections BILL-CC For Collection Chases BILL-CR For Collection Rejection
Note : For Drawings, not all possible drawing types will need to be set up for each lc type since under one type a 'SP' and 'AC' cannot be input.

With the above records defined here, then each type an L/C is input with type equal to 'BILL' and Operation equal to 'O', then the default charges will be picked up from the fields for commission and charges defined in the record 'BILL-O'.

The key to the file, the value here will be defined as the LC.TYPE followed by either the LC.OPERATION for Letters of Credit, or the DRAWING.TYPE for Drawings.

Whenever a transaction is input via the Letter of Credit/Documentary Collections or Drawings applications, a key is built up of the current LC.TYPE and the current operation (For L/Cs), or the Drawing type (for drawings). This key is then used to retrieve a record from this file in order to set up all the default charges for the current transaction.
For Letters of Credit, the key is defined as:
[LC.TYPE]'-'[OPERATION]
For Drawings, the key is defined as:
[LC.TYPE]'-'[DRAWING.TYPE]
Where LC.TYPE is from the parent Letter of Credit record.
